lines.content: This document records the use of AI tools during the development of this project, including what they were used for and reflections on their effectiveness.
| Level 2–6        | Google DeepMind Agentic AI        | Generating initial skeletal classes and basic OOP structure. |
| A-Collections    | Google DeepMind Agentic AI        | Refactoring task storage from arrays to `ArrayList`. |
| A-Enums          | Google DeepMind Agentic AI        | Refactoring constants in `AK.java` into enums. |
- **Rapid prototyping**: AI significantly reduced setup time by generating boilerplate code and class structures quickly.
- **Refactoring assistance**: Structural refactors (arrays → `ArrayList`, constants → enums) were handled accurately and saved manual effort.
- **Consistency**: Generated code generally followed existing project style and conventions.
- **Edge cases and logic validation**: AI-generated code occasionally required manual correction for edge cases and integration with existing logic.
- **Overgeneralization**: Some suggestions were broader than needed and had to be trimmed down to fit assignment constraints.
- The use of AI tools saved a noticeable amount of development time, especially during early scaffolding and refactoring stages.
- Final correctness and design decisions still required human review and adjustment.
This file will be updated periodically as AI tools continue to be used.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Anime Character from JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Golden Experience Requiem. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Requiem.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Requiem.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
